result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Comply fully with investigations as requested regarding co-defendants. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

Defendant Miguel A Diaz in court with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing, however the state is requesting an adjournment due to co-defendant case not having been resolved yet and the state wishes to have disposition on that case.  Attorney Carson objects to adjournment request.  Court denies request and proceeds with sentencing today.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Carson makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

120 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   **transfer allowed to Miwaukee County** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Comply fully with investigations as requested regarding Co-Defendants
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 09:15 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Miguel A Diaz in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. Case passed for State to file corrected Amended information. Corrected amended information filed. Case re-called at 3:10 pm. Previously filed information is rescinded. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #2 of the Amended Information. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #2 of the Amended Information. Attorney Carson requests a separate sentencing hearing. Court sets.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:15 am.
AMENDED INFORMATION THAT WAS RESCINDED.

Plea hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
